        <section id="query-areExecutorsConfigured" class="operation operation-query" data-traverse-target="query-areExecutorsConfigured">
          <h2 class="operation-heading ">
            <code>areExecutorsConfigured</code>
          </h2>
          <div class="doc-row">
            <div class="doc-copy">
              <div class="operation-description doc-copy-section">
                <h5>Description</h5>
                <p>Returns true if executors have been configured on the Sourcegraph instance. This is based on heuristics and doesn&#39;t necessarily mean that they would be working.</p>
              </div>
            </div>
          </div>
          <div class="doc-row">
            <div class="doc-copy">
              <div class="operation-response doc-copy-section">
                <h5>Response</h5>
                <p> Returns a <a href="#definition-Boolean"><code>Boolean!</code></a>
                </p>
              </div>
            </div>
            <div class="doc-examples">
              <h4 class="example-heading">Example</h4>
              <div class="example-section example-section-is-code operation-query-example">
                <h5>Query</h5>
                <html>
                  <head></head>
                  <body><pre><code class="hljs language-gql"><span class="hljs-symbol"><span class="hljs-keyword">query</span> areExecutorsConfigured <span class="hljs-tag">{
  <span class="hljs-symbol">areExecutorsConfigured</span>
}</span></span>
</code></pre>
                  </body>
                </html>
              </div>
              <div class="example-section example-section-is-code operation-response-example">
                <h5>Response</h5>
                <html>
                  <head></head>
                  <body><pre><code class="hljs language-json"><span class="hljs-punctuation">{</span><span class="hljs-attr">"data"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-punctuation">{</span><span class="hljs-attr">"areExecutorsConfigured"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-literal"><span class="hljs-keyword">false</span></span><span class="hljs-punctuation">}</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">}</span>
</code></pre>
                  </body>
                </html>
              </div>
            </div>
          </div>
        </section>

                  <thead>

                    </tr>
                  </thead>
                  <tbody>
                    <tr>
                      <td>
                        <span class="property-name"><code>first</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-Int"><code>Int</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> Returns the first n repositories from the list. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td>
                        <span class="property-name"><code>last</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-Int"><code>Int</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> Returns the last n repositories from the list. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td>
                        <span class="property-name"><code>query</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-String"><code>String</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> Return repositories whose names match the query. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td>
                        <span class="property-name"><code>after</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-String"><code>String</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> An opaque cursor that is used for pagination. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td>
                        <span class="property-name"><code>before</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-String"><code>String</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> An opaque cursor that is used for pagination. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td>
                        <span class="property-name"><code>names</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-String"><code>[String!]</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> Return repositories whose names are in the list. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td>
                        <span class="property-name"><code>cloned</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-Boolean"><code>Boolean</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> Include cloned repositories. Default = <code>true</code> </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td>
                        <span class="property-name"><code>cloneStatus</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-CloneStatus"><code>CloneStatus</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> Include only repositories of the given clone status. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td>
                        <span class="property-name"><code>notCloned</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-Boolean"><code>Boolean</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> Include repositories that are not yet cloned and for which cloning is not in progress. Default = <code>true</code> </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td>
                        <span class="property-name"><code>indexed</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-Boolean"><code>Boolean</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> Include repositories that have a text search index. Default = <code>true</code> </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td>
                        <span class="property-name"><code>notIndexed</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-Boolean"><code>Boolean</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> Include repositories that do not have a text search index. Default = <code>true</code> </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td>
                        <span class="property-name"><code>failedFetch</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-Boolean"><code>Boolean</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> Include only repositories that have encountered errors when cloning or fetching. Default = <code>false</code> </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td>
                        <span class="property-name"><code>corrupted</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-Boolean"><code>Boolean</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> Include repositories that are corrupt. Default = <code>false</code> </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td>
                        <span class="property-name"><code>externalService</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-ID"><code>ID</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> Return repositories that are associated with the given external service. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td>
                        <span class="property-name"><code>orderBy</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-RepositoryOrderBy"><code>RepositoryOrderBy</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> Sort field. Default = <code>REPOSITORY_NAME</code> </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td>
                        <span class="property-name"><code>descending</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-Boolean"><code>Boolean</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> Sort direction. Default = <code>false</code> </td>
                    </tr>
                  </tbody>
                </table>

            </div>

        <section id="query-repositoryRedirect" class="operation operation-query" data-traverse-target="query-repositoryRedirect">
          <div class="operation-group-name">

          <h2 class="operation-heading ">

          <div class="doc-row">
            <div class="doc-copy">
              <div class="operation-description doc-copy-section">
                <h5>Description</h5>
                <p>Looks up a repository by either name or cloneURL or hashedName. When the repository does not exist on the server and &quot;disablePublicRepoRedirects&quot; is &quot;false&quot; in the site configuration, it returns a Redirect to an external Sourcegraph URL that may have this repository instead. Otherwise, this query returns null.</p>
              </div>
            </div>
          </div>
          <div class="doc-row">
            <div class="doc-copy">
              <div class="operation-response doc-copy-section">

                <p> Returns a <a href="#definition-RepositoryRedirect"><code>RepositoryRedirect</code></a>
                </p>
              </div>
              <div class="operation-arguments doc-copy-section">
                <h5>Arguments</h5>
                <table>
                  <thead>
                    <tr>
                      <th>Name</th>
                      <th>Description</th>
                    </tr>
                  </thead>
                  <tbody>
                    <tr>
                      <td>
                        <span class="property-name"><code>name</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-String"><code>String</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> Query the repository by name, for example "github.com/gorilla/mux". </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td>
                        <span class="property-name"><code>cloneURL</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-String"><code>String</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> Query the repository by a Git clone URL (format documented here: <a href="https://git-scm.com/docs/git-clone_git_urls_a_id_urls_a">https://git-scm.com/docs/git-clone_git_urls_a_id_urls_a</a>) by checking for a code host configuration that matches the clone URL. Will not actually check the code host to see if the repository actually exists. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td>
                        <span class="property-name"><code>hashedName</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-String"><code>String</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> Query the repository by hashed name. Hashed name is a SHA256 checksum of the absolute repo name in lower case, for example "github.com/sourcegraph/sourcegraph" -&gt; "a6c905ceb7dec9a565945ceded8c7fa4154250df8b928fb40673b535d9a24c2f" </td>
                    </tr>

                <table>
                  <thead>

                    </tr>
                  </thead>
                  <tbody>

                      <td>
                        <span class="property-name"><code>first</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-Int"><code>Int</code></a></span>

                        <span class="property-name"><code>query</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-String"><code>String</code></a></span>

                        <span class="property-name"><code>tag</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-String"><code>String</code></a></span>

                <p>Returns recently received webhooks across all external services, optionally limiting the returned values to only those that didn&#39;t match any external service.</p>
                <p>Only site admins can access this field.</p>
              </div>

                </p>

              <div class="operation-arguments doc-copy-section">
                <h5>Arguments</h5>
                <table>
                  <thead>
                    <tr>
                      <th>Name</th>
                      <th>Description</th>
                    </tr>
                  </thead>
                  <tbody>
                    <tr>
                      <td>
                        <span class="property-name"><code>first</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-Int"><code>Int</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> Returns the first n webhook logs. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td>
                        <span class="property-name"><code>after</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-String"><code>String</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> Opaque pagination cursor. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td>
                        <span class="property-name"><code>onlyErrors</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-Boolean"><code>Boolean</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> Only include webhook logs that resulted in errors. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td>
                        <span class="property-name"><code>onlyUnmatched</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-Boolean"><code>Boolean</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> Only include webhook logs that were not matched to an external service. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td>
                        <span class="property-name"><code>since</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-DateTime"><code>DateTime</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> Only include webhook logs on or after this time. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td>
                        <span class="property-name"><code>until</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-DateTime"><code>DateTime</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> Only include webhook logs on or before this time. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td>
                        <span class="property-name"><code>webhookID</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-ID"><code>ID</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> Only include webhook logs of given webhook ID. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td>
                        <span class="property-name"><code>legacyOnly</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-Boolean"><code>Boolean</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> Only include webhook logs that have no webhook ID set. </td>
                    </tr>

          </div>
          <h2 class="operation-heading ">
            <code>addUserToOrganization</code>
          </h2>
          <div class="doc-row">
            <div class="doc-copy">
              <div class="operation-description doc-copy-section">
                <h5>Description</h5>
                <p>Immediately add a user as a member to the organization, without sending an invitation email.</p>
                <p>Only site admins may perform this mutation. Organization members may use the inviteUserToOrganization mutation to invite users.</p>
              </div>

        <section id="mutation-createAccessToken" class="operation operation-mutation" data-traverse-target="mutation-createAccessToken">
          <div class="operation-group-name">
            <a href="#group-Operations-Mutations">Mutations</a>
          </div>
          <h2 class="operation-heading ">
            <code>createAccessToken</code>
          </h2>
          <div class="doc-row">
            <div class="doc-copy">
              <div class="operation-description doc-copy-section">
                <h5>Description</h5>
                <p>Creates an access token that grants the privileges of the specified user (referred to as the access token&#39;s &quot;subject&quot; user after token creation). The result is the access token value, which the caller is responsible for storing (it is not accessible by Sourcegraph after creation).</p>
                <p>The supported scopes are:</p>
                <ul>
                  <li>&quot;user:all&quot;: Full control of all resources accessible to the user account.</li>
                  <li>&quot;site-admin:sudo&quot;: Ability to perform any action as any other user. (Only site admins may create tokens with this scope.)</li>
                </ul>
                <p>Only the user or site admins may perform this mutation.</p>
              </div>
            </div>
          </div>
          <div class="doc-row">
            <div class="doc-copy">
              <div class="operation-response doc-copy-section">

                </p>

                    </tr>

                    <tr>
                      <td>
                        <span class="property-name"><code>user</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-ID"><code>ID!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td>
                      </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td>
                        <span class="property-name"><code>scopes</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-String"><code>[String!]!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td>
                      </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td>
                        <span class="property-name"><code>note</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-String"><code>String!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td>
                      </td>
                    </tr>
                  </tbody>
                </table>
              </div>
            </div>
            <div class="doc-examples">
              <h4 class="example-heading">Example</h4>
              <div class="example-section example-section-is-code operation-query-example">
                <h5>Query</h5>
                <html>
                  <head></head>
                  <body><pre><code class="hljs language-gql"><span class="hljs-symbol"><span class="hljs-keyword">mutation</span> createAccessToken<span class="hljs-tag">(
  <span class="hljs-code">$user</span>: ID!,

          <h2 class="operation-heading ">

          </h2>
          <div class="doc-row">
            <div class="doc-copy">
              <div class="operation-description doc-copy-section">
                <h5>Description</h5>
                <p>Create a new executor secret. See argument descriptions for more details.</p>
              </div>
            </div>
          </div>
          <div class="doc-row">
            <div class="doc-copy">
              <div class="operation-response doc-copy-section">
                <h5>Response</h5>
                <p> Returns an <a href="#definition-ExecutorSecret"><code>ExecutorSecret!</code></a>
                </p>
              </div>
              <div class="operation-arguments doc-copy-section">
                <h5>Arguments</h5>
                <table>
                  <thead>
                    <tr>
                      <th>Name</th>
                      <th>Description</th>
                    </tr>
                  </thead>
                  <tbody>
                    <tr>
                      <td>
                        <span class="property-name"><code>scope</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-ExecutorSecretScope"><code>ExecutorSecretScope!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> The scope for which the secret is usable. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td>
                        <span class="property-name"><code>key</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-String"><code>String!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> The key under which the secret is known. For executions, this is the name of the environment variable this secret will be accessible under. It is therefore advised that key only contains uppercase letters, numbers and underscores. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td>
                        <span class="property-name"><code>value</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-String"><code>String!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> The secret value. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td>
                        <span class="property-name"><code>namespace</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-ID"><code>ID</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> The namespace this secret is for. If not set, a global secret is created that is accessible by all users. Creating a global secret requires site-admin permissions. Creating a namespaced secret requires write-access to the namespace. </td>
                    </tr>
                  </tbody>
                </table>
              </div>
            </div>
            <div class="doc-examples">
              <h4 class="example-heading">Example</h4>
              <div class="example-section example-section-is-code operation-query-example">
                <h5>Query</h5>
                <html>

        <section id="mutation-createTeam" class="operation operation-mutation" data-traverse-target="mutation-createTeam">

          <div class="doc-row">
            <div class="doc-copy">
              <div class="operation-description doc-copy-section">
                <h5>Description</h5>
                <p>Creates a team. The name must be unique, display name can be used to set a custom display value for the team inside Sourcegraph.</p>
                <p>If readonly is true, the Sourcegraph UI will show a warning banner that this team is managed externally, and it can only be modified by site-admins. This is to prevent state drift from external systems that ingest team information into Sourcegraph. Readonly can only be set by site-admins.</p>
                <p>Either parentTeam XOR parentTeamName can be specified to make the team a child team of the given parent. Only members of the parent team or site-admis can create a child team.</p>
              </div>
            </div>
          </div>

            <div class="doc-copy">

        <section id="mutation-deleteUser" class="operation operation-mutation" data-traverse-target="mutation-deleteUser">
          <div class="operation-group-name">
            <a href="#group-Operations-Mutations">Mutations</a>
          </div>
          <h2 class="operation-heading ">
            <code>deleteUser</code>
          </h2>
          <div class="doc-row">
            <div class="doc-copy">
              <div class="operation-description doc-copy-section">
                <h5>Description</h5>
                <p>Deletes a user account. Only site admins may perform this mutation.</p>
                <p>If hard == true, a hard delete is performed. By default, deletes are &#39;soft deletes&#39; and could theoretically be undone with manual DB commands. If a hard delete is performed, the data is truly removed from the database and deletion can NEVER be undone.</p>
                <p>Data that is deleted as part of this operation:</p>
                <ul>
                  <li>All user data (access tokens, email addresses, external account info, survey responses, etc)</li>
                  <li>Organization membership information (which organizations the user is a part of, any invitations created by or targeting the user).</li>
                  <li>Sourcegraph extensions published by the user.</li>
                  <li>User, Organization, or Global settings authored by the user.</li>
                </ul>
              </div>
            </div>
          </div>
          <div class="doc-row">
            <div class="doc-copy">
              <div class="operation-response doc-copy-section">
                <h5>Response</h5>
                <p> Returns an <a href="#definition-EmptyResponse"><code>EmptyResponse</code></a>
                </p>
              </div>
              <div class="operation-arguments doc-copy-section">

                      <th>Description</th>
                    </tr>
                  </thead>
                  <tbody>
                    <tr>
                      <td>
                        <span class="property-name"><code>user</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-ID"><code>ID!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td>
                      </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td>
                        <span class="property-name"><code>hard</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-Boolean"><code>Boolean</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td>
                      </td>
                    </tr>
                  </tbody>
                </table>
              </div>
            </div>
            <div class="doc-examples">
              <h4 class="example-heading">Example</h4>
              <div class="example-section example-section-is-code operation-query-example">

                <html>

                  <body><pre><code class="hljs language-gql"><span class="hljs-symbol"><span class="hljs-keyword">mutation</span> deleteUser<span class="hljs-tag">(

                <p>Only site admins and any member of the organization may perform this mutation.</p>

        <section id="mutation-setMigrationDirection" class="operation operation-mutation" data-traverse-target="mutation-setMigrationDirection">
          <div class="operation-group-name">
            <a href="#group-Operations-Mutations">Mutations</a>
          </div>
          <h2 class="operation-heading ">
            <code>setMigrationDirection</code>
          </h2>
          <div class="doc-row">
            <div class="doc-copy">
              <div class="operation-description doc-copy-section">
                <h5>Description</h5>
                <p>Updates an out-of-band migration to run in a particular direction.</p>
                <p>Applied in the forward direction, an out-of-band migration migrates data into a format that is readable by newer Sourcegraph instances. This may be destructive or non-destructive process, depending on the nature and implementation of the migration.</p>
                <p>Applied in the reverse direction, an out-of-band migration ensures that data is moved back into a format that is readable by the previous Sourcegraph instance. Recently introduced migrations should be applied in reverse prior to downgrading the instance.</p>
              </div>
            </div>
          </div>
          <div class="doc-row">
            <div class="doc-copy">
              <div class="operation-response doc-copy-section">
                <h5>Response</h5>
                <p> Returns an <a href="#definition-EmptyResponse"><code>EmptyResponse!</code></a>
                </p>
              </div>
              <div class="operation-arguments doc-copy-section">
                <h5>Arguments</h5>
                <table>
                  <thead>
                    <tr>
                      <th>Name</th>
                      <th>Description</th>
                    </tr>
                  </thead>
                  <tbody>
                    <tr>
                      <td>
                        <span class="property-name"><code>id</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-ID"><code>ID!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td>
                      </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td>
                        <span class="property-name"><code>applyReverse</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-Boolean"><code>Boolean!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td>
                      </td>
                    </tr>
                  </tbody>
                </table>
              </div>
            </div>
            <div class="doc-examples">
              <h4 class="example-heading">Example</h4>
              <div class="example-section example-section-is-code operation-query-example">
                <h5>Query</h5>
                <html>
                  <head></head>
                  <body><pre><code class="hljs language-gql"><span class="hljs-symbol"><span class="hljs-keyword">mutation</span> setMigrationDirection<span class="hljs-tag">(
  <span class="hljs-code">$id</span>: ID!,
  <span class="hljs-code">$applyReverse</span>:<span class="hljs-type"> Boolean!</span>
)</span> <span class="hljs-tag">{
  <span class="hljs-symbol">setMigrationDirection<span class="hljs-tag">(
    id: <span class="hljs-code">$id</span>,
    applyReverse: <span class="hljs-code">$applyReverse</span>
  )</span> <span class="hljs-tag">{

                <h5>Description</h5>
                <p>This is a convenience method to forcefully overwrite the full set of members of a team. This is handy to sync external state without diffing the current members vs the desired set of members.</p>
                <p>Either team XOR teamName can be specified to specify the team. Must be team member to modify team members, or site-admin.</p>
                <p>For now, members can only be the IDs of User entities in Sourcegraph. Later, we will expand this to allow Persons as well.</p>

        <section id="mutation-updateTeam" class="operation operation-mutation" data-traverse-target="mutation-updateTeam">

          </div>
          <h2 class="operation-heading ">

          </h2>
          <div class="doc-row">
            <div class="doc-copy">
              <div class="operation-description doc-copy-section">
                <h5>Description</h5>
                <p>Update an existing team. ID or Name must be specified, but not both.</p>
                <p>To unset the display name, pass an empty string. Null will make it ignore updates.</p>
                <p>Either parentTeam XOR parentTeamName can be specified to make the team a child team of the given parent. The user has to be a team-member of both the child and parent team for that, and neither can be read-only. Site-admin can modify all teams without constraints.</p>
              </div>
            </div>
          </div>

        <section id="definition-AccessToken" class="definition definition-object" data-traverse-target="definition-AccessToken">
          <h2 class="definition-heading">AccessToken</h2>
          <div class="doc-row">
            <div class="doc-copy">
              <div class="definition-description doc-copy-section">
                <h5>Description</h5>
                <p>An access token that grants to the holder the privileges of the user who created it.</p>
              </div>
              <div class="definition-properties doc-copy-section">
                <h5>Fields</h5>
                <table>
                  <thead>
                    <tr>
                      <th>Field Name</th>
                      <th>Description</th>
                    </tr>
                  </thead>
                  <tbody>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>id</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-ID"><code>ID!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> The unique ID for the access token. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>subject</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-User"><code>User!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> The user whose privileges the access token grants. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>scopes</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-String"><code>[String!]!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> The scopes that define the allowed set of operations that can be performed using this access token. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>note</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-String"><code>String!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> A user-supplied descriptive note for the access token. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>creator</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-User"><code>User!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> The user who created the access token. This is either the subject user (if the access token was created by the same user) or a site admin (who can create access tokens for any user). </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>createdAt</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-DateTime"><code>DateTime!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> The date when the access token was created. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>lastUsedAt</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-DateTime"><code>DateTime</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> The date when the access token was last used to authenticate a request. </td>
                    </tr>
                  </tbody>
                </table>
              </div>
            </div>
            <div class="doc-examples">
              <div class="example-section example-section-is-code">
                <h5>Example</h5>
                <html>
                  <head></head>
                  <body><pre><code class="hljs language-json"><span class="hljs-punctuation">{</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"id"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-number">4</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"subject"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">User</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"scopes"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-punctuation">[</span><span class="hljs-string">"abc123"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">]</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"note"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">"xyz789"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"creator"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">User</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"createdAt"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">"2007-12-03T10:15:30Z"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"lastUsedAt"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">"2007-12-03T10:15:30Z"</span>
<span class="hljs-punctuation">}</span>
</code></pre>
                  </body>
                </html>
              </div>
            </div>
          </div>
        </section>

        <section id="definition-AuthProvider" class="definition definition-object" data-traverse-target="definition-AuthProvider">

                      </td>

                    </tr>

                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>clientID</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-String"><code>String!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> An identifier for the client of the service that the auth provider represents. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>displayName</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-String"><code>String!</code></a></span>
                      </td>

                      </td>

                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>authenticationURL</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-String"><code>String</code></a></span>

          </div>
          <h2 class="definition-heading">CodeIntelGitBlob</h2>
          <div class="doc-row">
            <div class="doc-copy">
              <div class="definition-description doc-copy-section">
                <h5>Description</h5>
                <p>A gitblob resolver specific to code intel.</p>
              </div>
              <div class="definition-properties doc-copy-section">
                <h5>Fields</h5>
                <table>
                  <thead>
                    <tr>
                      <th>Field Name</th>
                      <th>Description</th>
                    </tr>
                  </thead>
                  <tbody>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>path</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-String"><code>String!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> The full path (relative to the root) of this tree. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>name</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-String"><code>String!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> The base name (i.e., last path component only) of this tree. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>commit</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-CodeIntelCommit"><code>CodeIntelCommit!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> The Git commit containing this tree. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>url</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-String"><code>String!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> The URL to this tree (using the input revision specifier, which may not be immutable). </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>repository</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-CodeIntelRepository"><code>CodeIntelRepository!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> The repository containing this tree. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr class="row-has-field-arguments">
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>content</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-String"><code>String!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> The content of this blob. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr class="row-field-arguments">
                      <td colspan="2">
                        <div class="field-arguments">
                          <h5 class="field-arguments-heading"> Arguments </h5>
                          <div class="field-argument-list">
                            <div class="field-argument">
                              <h6 class="field-argument-name"><span class="property-name"><code>startLine</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-Int"><code>Int</code></a></span>
                              </h6>
                              <p>Return file content starting at line &quot;startLine&quot;. A value &lt;= 0 will be the start of the file.</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="field-argument">
                              <h6 class="field-argument-name"><span class="property-name"><code>endLine</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-Int"><code>Int</code></a></span>
                              </h6>
                              <p>Return file content ending at line &quot;endLine&quot;. A value &lt; 0 or &gt; totalLines will set endLine to the end of the file.</p>
                            </div>
                          </div>
                        </div>
                      </td>
                    </tr>
                  </tbody>
                </table>

  <span class="hljs-attr">"name"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">"abc123"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"commit"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">CodeIntelCommit</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"url"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">"abc123"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"repository"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">CodeIntelRepository</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"content"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">"abc123"</span>
<span class="hljs-punctuation">}</span>
</code></pre>
                  </body>

        <section id="definition-CodeIntelRepository" class="definition definition-object" data-traverse-target="definition-CodeIntelRepository">
          <div class="definition-group-name">
            <a href="#group-Types">Types</a>
          </div>
          <h2 class="definition-heading">CodeIntelRepository</h2>
          <div class="doc-row">
            <div class="doc-copy">
              <div class="definition-description doc-copy-section">
                <h5>Description</h5>
                <p>A codeintel repository is a Git source control repository that is mirrored from some origin code host and it is specific to code intel.</p>
              </div>
              <div class="definition-properties doc-copy-section">
                <h5>Fields</h5>
                <table>
                  <thead>
                    <tr>
                      <th>Field Name</th>
                      <th>Description</th>
                    </tr>
                  </thead>
                  <tbody>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>id</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-ID"><code>ID!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> The globally addressable ID for this commit. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>name</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-String"><code>String!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td>
                        <p>The repository&#39;s name, as a path with one or more components. It conventionally consists of the repository&#39;s hostname and path (joined by &quot;/&quot;), minus any suffixes (such as &quot;.git&quot;). Examples:</p>
                        <ul>
                          <li>github.com/foo/bar</li>
                          <li>my-code-host.example.com/myrepo</li>
                          <li>myrepo</li>
                        </ul>
                      </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>url</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-String"><code>String!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> The URL to this repository. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>externalRepository</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-CodeIntelExternalRepository"><code>CodeIntelExternalRepository</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> Information about this repository from the external service that it originates from (such as GitHub, GitLab, Phabricator, etc.). Only populated when used as part of repository list previews for configuration policies. </td>
                    </tr>
                  </tbody>
                </table>
              </div>
            </div>
            <div class="doc-examples">
              <div class="example-section example-section-is-code">
                <h5>Example</h5>
                <html>
                  <head></head>
                  <body><pre><code class="hljs language-json"><span class="hljs-punctuation">{</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"id"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-number">4</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"name"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">"xyz789"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"url"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">"xyz789"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"externalRepository"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">CodeIntelExternalRepository</span>
<span class="hljs-punctuation">}</span>
</code></pre>
                  </body>
                </html>
              </div>
            </div>
          </div>
        </section>

                    </tr>
                    <tr>

                    </tr>

                      </td>

                    </tr>
                    <tr>

  <span class="hljs-attr">"url"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">"abc123"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"detail"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">Markdown</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>

  <span class="hljs-attr">"commit"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">GitCommit</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"refs"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-punctuation">[</span><span class="hljs-string">GitRef</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">]</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"sourceRefs"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-punctuation">[</span><span class="hljs-string">GitRef</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">]</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"messagePreview"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">HighlightedString</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"diffPreview"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">HighlightedString</span>
<span class="hljs-punctuation">}</span>

                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td>
                        <span class="property-name"><code>firstSourceURL</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-String"><code>String</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> The first sourcegraph URL visited by the user, stored in a browser cookie. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td>
                        <span class="property-name"><code>lastSourceURL</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-String"><code>String</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> The last sourcegraph URL visited by the user, stored in a browser cookie. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td>
                        <span class="property-name"><code>url</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-String"><code>String!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> The URL when the event was logged. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td>
                        <span class="property-name"><code>source</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-EventSource"><code>EventSource!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> The source of the event. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td>
                        <span class="property-name"><code>cohortID</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-String"><code>String</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> An optional cohort ID to identify the user as part of a specific A/B test. The cohort ID is expected to be a date in the form YYYY-MM-DD </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td>
                        <span class="property-name"><code>referrer</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-String"><code>String</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> An optional referrer parameter for the user's current session. Only captured and stored on Sourcegraph Cloud. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td>
                        <span class="property-name"><code>originalReferrer</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-String"><code>String</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> The original referrer for a user </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td>
                        <span class="property-name"><code>sessionReferrer</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-String"><code>String</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> The session referrer for a user </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td>
                        <span class="property-name"><code>sessionFirstURL</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-String"><code>String</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> The sessions first url for a user </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td>
                        <span class="property-name"><code>deviceSessionID</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-String"><code>String</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> Device session ID to identify the user's session for analytics. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td>
                        <span class="property-name"><code>argument</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-String"><code>String</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> The additional argument information. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td>
                        <span class="property-name"><code>publicArgument</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-String"><code>String</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> Public argument information. PRIVACY: Do NOT include any potentially private information in this field. These properties get sent to our analytics tools for Cloud, so must not include private information, such as search queries or repository names. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td>
                        <span class="property-name"><code>deviceID</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-String"><code>String</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> Device ID used for Amplitude analytics. Used on Sourcegraph Cloud only. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td>
                        <span class="property-name"><code>eventID</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-Int"><code>Int</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> Event ID used to deduplicate events that occur simultaneously in Amplitude analytics. See <a href="https://developers.amplitude.com/docs/http-api-v2#optional-keys">https://developers.amplitude.com/docs/http-api-v2#optional-keys</a>. Used on Sourcegraph Cloud only. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td>
                        <span class="property-name"><code>insertID</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-String"><code>String</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> Insert ID used to deduplicate events that re-occur in the event of retries or backfills in Amplitude analytics. See <a href="https://developers.amplitude.com/docs/http-api-v2#optional-keys">https://developers.amplitude.com/docs/http-api-v2#optional-keys</a>. Used on Sourcegraph Cloud only. </td>
                    </tr>
                  </tbody>

                    </tr>

                      </td>

                      </td>

                    </tr>

                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>compatibility</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-ExecutorCompatibility"><code>ExecutorCompatibility</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td>
                        <p>The compatibility of the executor with respect to the Sourcegraph instance. If outdated, please make sure that the executor and the Sourcegraph backend are of compatible versions. This means they should match in major and minor version, but they may be 1 minor version apart. If too new, please update the Sourcegraph instance to match the version of the executor or downgrade the executor.</p>
                        <p>Compatibility can be null if the executor or Sourcegraph instance runs in dev mode or there&#39;s a version mismatch.</p>

          <div class="doc-row">
            <div class="doc-copy">
              <div class="definition-description doc-copy-section">
                <h5>Description</h5>
                <p>A secret to be used in executor jobs.</p>
              </div>
              <div class="definition-properties doc-copy-section">
                <h5>Fields</h5>
                <table>
                  <thead>
                    <tr>
                      <th>Field Name</th>
                      <th>Description</th>
                    </tr>
                  </thead>
                  <tbody>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>id</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-ID"><code>ID!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> The unique identifier of the secret. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>key</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-String"><code>String!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> The key under which the secret is available. Secrets are usually exposed as environment variables named using this key. Recommended format: uppercase letters, numbers and underscores. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>scope</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-ExecutorSecretScope"><code>ExecutorSecretScope!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> The scope of this secret. The secret will only be usable for jobs in this particular scope. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>overwritesGlobalSecret</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-Boolean"><code>Boolean!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> If true, this secret is defined in a namespace and a secret with the same key is also defined in the global namespace, which this secret overwrites. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>namespace</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-Namespace"><code>Namespace</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> The namespace this secret belongs to. Null, if a global secret. Global secrets are available to every execution. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>creator</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-User"><code>User</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> The creator of the secret. Null, if the creator has been deleted. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>createdAt</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-DateTime"><code>DateTime!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> The date and time this secret has been created. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>updatedAt</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-DateTime"><code>DateTime!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> The date and time this secret has been last updated. </td>
                    </tr>

                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>accessLogs</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-ExecutorSecretAccessLogConnection"><code>ExecutorSecretAccessLogConnection!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> The list of access events to this secret. Every time the secret value is decoded and used, one of these entries is created. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr class="row-field-arguments">
                      <td colspan="2">
                        <div class="field-arguments">
                          <h5 class="field-arguments-heading"> Arguments </h5>
                          <div class="field-argument-list">
                            <div class="field-argument">
                              <h6 class="field-argument-name"><span class="property-name"><code>first</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-Int"><code>Int</code></a></span>
                              </h6>

                              <h6 class="field-argument-name"><span class="property-name"><code>after</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-String"><code>String</code></a></span>
                              </h6>

                          </div>
                        </div>
                      </td>
                    </tr>
                  </tbody>
                </table>
              </div>
            </div>

                  <body><pre><code class="hljs language-json"><span class="hljs-punctuation">{</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"id"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-number">4</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"key"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">"xyz789"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>

  <span class="hljs-attr">"overwritesGlobalSecret"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-literal"><span class="hljs-keyword">false</span></span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>

  <span class="hljs-attr">"creator"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">User</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"createdAt"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">"2007-12-03T10:15:30Z"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"updatedAt"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">"2007-12-03T10:15:30Z"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"accessLogs"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">ExecutorSecretAccessLogConnection</span>

        <section id="definition-ExtensionManifest" class="definition definition-object" data-traverse-target="definition-ExtensionManifest">
          <div class="definition-group-name">
            <a href="#group-Types">Types</a>
          </div>
          <h2 class="definition-heading">ExtensionManifest</h2>
          <div class="doc-row">
            <div class="doc-copy">
              <div class="definition-description doc-copy-section">
                <h5>Description</h5>
                <p>A description of the extension, how to run or access it, and when to activate it.</p>
              </div>
              <div class="definition-properties doc-copy-section">
                <h5>Fields</h5>
                <table>
                  <thead>
                    <tr>
                      <th>Field Name</th>
                      <th>Description</th>
                    </tr>
                  </thead>
                  <tbody>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>raw</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-String"><code>String!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> The raw JSON (or JSONC) contents of the manifest. This value may be large (because many manifests contain README and icon data), and it is JSONC (not strict JSON), which means it must be parsed with a JSON parser that supports trailing commas and comments. Consider using jsonFields instead. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr class="row-has-field-arguments">
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>jsonFields</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-JSONValue"><code>JSONValue!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> The manifest as JSON (not JSONC, even if the raw manifest is JSONC) with only the specified fields. This is useful for callers that only need certain fields and want to avoid fetching a large amount of data (because many manifests contain README and icon data). </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr class="row-field-arguments">
                      <td colspan="2">
                        <div class="field-arguments">
                          <h5 class="field-arguments-heading"> Arguments </h5>
                          <div class="field-argument-list">
                            <div class="field-argument">
                              <h6 class="field-argument-name"><span class="property-name"><code>fields</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-String"><code>[String!]!</code></a></span>
                              </h6>
                            </div>
                          </div>
                        </div>
                      </td>
                    </tr>
                  </tbody>
                </table>
              </div>
            </div>
            <div class="doc-examples">
              <div class="example-section example-section-is-code">
                <h5>Example</h5>
                <html>
                  <head></head>
                  <body><pre><code class="hljs language-json"><span class="hljs-punctuation">{</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"raw"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">"xyz789"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"jsonFields"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">JSONValue</span>
<span class="hljs-punctuation">}</span>
</code></pre>
                  </body>
                </html>
              </div>
            </div>
          </div>
        </section>

        <section id="definition-ExternalAccount" class="definition definition-object" data-traverse-target="definition-ExternalAccount">
          <div class="definition-group-name">
            <a href="#group-Types">Types</a>
          </div>
          <h2 class="definition-heading">ExternalAccount</h2>
          <div class="doc-row">
            <div class="doc-copy">
              <div class="definition-description doc-copy-section">
                <h5>Description</h5>
                <p>An external account associated with a user.</p>
              </div>
              <div class="definition-properties doc-copy-section">
                <h5>Fields</h5>
                <table>
                  <thead>
                    <tr>
                      <th>Field Name</th>
                      <th>Description</th>
                    </tr>
                  </thead>
                  <tbody>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>id</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-ID"><code>ID!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> The unique ID for the external account. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>user</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-User"><code>User!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> The user on Sourcegraph. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>serviceType</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-String"><code>String!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> The type of the external service where the external account resides. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>serviceID</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-String"><code>String!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> An identifier for the external service where the external account resides. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>clientID</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-String"><code>String!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> An identifier for the client of the external service where the external account resides. This distinguishes among multiple authentication providers that access the same service with different parameters. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>accountID</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-String"><code>String!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> An identifier for the external account (typically equal to or derived from the ID on the external service). </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>createdAt</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-DateTime"><code>DateTime!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> The creation date of this external account on Sourcegraph. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>updatedAt</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-DateTime"><code>DateTime!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> The last-updated date of this external account on Sourcegraph. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>refreshURL</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-String"><code>String</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> A URL that, when visited, re-initiates the authentication process. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>accountData</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-JSONValue"><code>JSONValue</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> Provider-specific data about the external account. Only site admins may query this field. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>publicAccountData</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-PublicExternalAccountData"><code>PublicExternalAccountData</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> Public provider-specific data about the external account. Only users that are linked to the external account and site admins may query this field. </td>
                    </tr>
                  </tbody>
                </table>
              </div>
            </div>
            <div class="doc-examples">
              <div class="example-section example-section-is-code">
                <h5>Example</h5>
                <html>
                  <head></head>
                  <body><pre><code class="hljs language-json"><span class="hljs-punctuation">{</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"id"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-number">4</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"user"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">User</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"serviceType"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">"xyz789"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"serviceID"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">"abc123"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"clientID"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">"abc123"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"accountID"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">"xyz789"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"createdAt"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">"2007-12-03T10:15:30Z"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"updatedAt"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">"2007-12-03T10:15:30Z"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"refreshURL"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">"xyz789"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"accountData"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">JSONValue</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"publicAccountData"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">PublicExternalAccountData</span>
<span class="hljs-punctuation">}</span>
</code></pre>
                  </body>
                </html>
              </div>
            </div>
          </div>
        </section>
