                  <tbody>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>subjects</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-SettingsSubject"><code>[SettingsSubject!]!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> The other settings subjects that are applied with lower precedence than this subject to form the final merged settings. For example, a user in 2 organizations would have the following settings subjects: site (global settings), org 1, org 2, and the user. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>final</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-String"><code>String!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> The effective final merged settings as (stringified) JSON, merged from all of the subjects. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name="" class="definition-deprecated"><span class="property-name"><code>merged</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-Configuration"><code>Configuration!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> DEPRECATED: This field will be removed in a future release. The effective final merged settings, merged from all of the subjects. <span class="deprecation-reason">use final instead</span>
                      </td>
                    </tr>
                  </tbody>
                </table>
              </div>
            </div>
            <div class="doc-examples">
              <div class="example-section example-section-is-code">
                <h5>Example</h5>
                <html>
                  <head></head>
                  <body><pre><code class="hljs language-json"><span class="hljs-punctuation">{</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"subjects"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-punctuation">[</span><span class="hljs-string">SettingsSubject</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">]</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"final"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">"xyz789"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"merged"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">Configuration</span>
<span class="hljs-punctuation">}</span>
</code></pre>
                  </body>
                </html>
              </div>
            </div>
          </div>
        </section>
        <section id="definition-SettingsEdit" class="definition definition-input-object" data-traverse-target="definition-SettingsEdit">
          <div class="definition-group-name">
            <a href="#group-Types">Types</a>
          </div>
          <h2 class="definition-heading">SettingsEdit</h2>
          <div class="doc-row">
            <div class="doc-copy">
              <div class="definition-description doc-copy-section">
                <h5>Description</h5>
                <p>An edit to a JSON property in a settings JSON object. The JSON property to edit can be nested.</p>
              </div>
              <div class="definition-properties doc-copy-section">
                <h5>Fields</h5>
                <table>
                  <thead>
                    <tr>
                      <th>Input Field</th>
                      <th>Description</th>
                    </tr>
                  </thead>
                  <tbody>
                    <tr>
                      <td>
                        <span class="property-name"><code>keyPath</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-KeyPathSegment"><code>[KeyPathSegment!]!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td>
                        <p>The key path of the property to update.</p>
                        <p>Inserting into an existing array is not yet supported.</p>
                      </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td>
                        <span class="property-name"><code>value</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-JSONValue"><code>JSONValue</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td>
                        <p>The new JSON-encoded value to insert. If the field&#39;s value is not set, the property is removed. (This is different from the field&#39;s value being the JSON null value.)</p>
                        <p>When the value is a non-primitive type, it must be specified using a GraphQL variable, not an inline literal, or else the GraphQL parser will return an error.</p>
                      </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td>
                        <span class="property-name"><code>valueIsJSONCEncodedString</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-Boolean"><code>Boolean</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> Whether to treat the value as a JSONC-encoded string, which makes it possible to perform an edit that preserves (or adds/removes) comments. Default = <code>false</code> </td>
                    </tr>
                  </tbody>
                </table>
              </div>
            </div>
            <div class="doc-examples">
              <div class="example-section example-section-is-code">
                <h5>Example</h5>
                <html>
                  <head></head>
                  <body><pre><code class="hljs language-json"><span class="hljs-punctuation">{</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"keyPath"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-punctuation">[</span><span class="hljs-string">KeyPathSegment</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">]</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"value"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">JSONValue</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"valueIsJSONCEncodedString"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-literal"><span class="hljs-keyword">true</span></span>
<span class="hljs-punctuation">}</span>
</code></pre>
                  </body>
                </html>
              </div>
            </div>
          </div>
        </section>
        <section id="definition-SettingsMutation" class="definition definition-object" data-traverse-target="definition-SettingsMutation">
          <div class="definition-group-name">
            <a href="#group-Types">Types</a>
          </div>
          <h2 class="definition-heading">SettingsMutation</h2>
          <div class="doc-row">
            <div class="doc-copy">
              <div class="definition-description doc-copy-section">
                <h5>Description</h5>
                <p>Mutations that update settings (global, organization, or user settings). These mutations are grouped together because they:</p>
                <ul>
                  <li>are all versioned to avoid race conditions with concurrent editors</li>
                  <li>all apply to a specific settings subject (i.e., a user, an organization, or the whole site)</li>
                </ul>
                <p>Grouping them lets us extract those common parameters to the Mutation.settingsMutation field.</p>
              </div>
              <div class="definition-properties doc-copy-section">
                <h5>Fields</h5>
                <table>
                  <thead>
                    <tr>
                      <th>Field Name</th>
                      <th>Description</th>
                    </tr>
                  </thead>
                  <tbody>
                    <tr class="row-has-field-arguments">
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>editSettings</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-UpdateSettingsPayload"><code>UpdateSettingsPayload</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> Edit a single property in the settings object. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr class="row-field-arguments">
                      <td colspan="2">
                        <div class="field-arguments">
                          <h5 class="field-arguments-heading"> Arguments </h5>
                          <div class="field-argument-list">
                            <div class="field-argument">
                              <h6 class="field-argument-name"><span class="property-name"><code>edit</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-SettingsEdit"><code>SettingsEdit!</code></a></span>
                              </h6>
                              <p>The edit to apply to the settings.</p>
                            </div>
                          </div>
                        </div>
                      </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr class="row-has-field-arguments">
                      <td data-property-name="" class="definition-deprecated"><span class="property-name"><code>editConfiguration</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-UpdateSettingsPayload"><code>UpdateSettingsPayload</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> DEPRECATED <span class="deprecation-reason">Use editSettings instead. This field is a deprecated alias for it and will be removed in a future release.</span>
                      </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr class="row-field-arguments">
                      <td colspan="2">
                        <div class="field-arguments">
                          <h5 class="field-arguments-heading"> Arguments </h5>
                          <div class="field-argument-list">
                            <div class="field-argument">
                              <h6 class="field-argument-name"><span class="property-name"><code>edit</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-ConfigurationEdit"><code>ConfigurationEdit!</code></a></span>
                              </h6>
                            </div>
                          </div>
                        </div>
                      </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr class="row-has-field-arguments">
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>overwriteSettings</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-UpdateSettingsPayload"><code>UpdateSettingsPayload</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> Overwrite the existing settings with the new settings. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr class="row-field-arguments">
                      <td colspan="2">
                        <div class="field-arguments">
                          <h5 class="field-arguments-heading"> Arguments </h5>
                          <div class="field-argument-list">
                            <div class="field-argument">
                              <h6 class="field-argument-name"><span class="property-name"><code>contents</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-String"><code>String!</code></a></span>
                              </h6>
                              <p>A JSON object (stringified) of the settings. Trailing commas and &quot;//&quot;-style comments are supported. The entire previous settings value will be overwritten by this new value.</p>
                            </div>
                          </div>
                        </div>
                      </td>
                    </tr>
                  </tbody>
                </table>
              </div>
            </div>
            <div class="doc-examples">
              <div class="example-section example-section-is-code">
                <h5>Example</h5>
                <html>
                  <head></head>
                  <body><pre><code class="hljs language-json"><span class="hljs-punctuation">{</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"editSettings"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">UpdateSettingsPayload</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"editConfiguration"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">UpdateSettingsPayload</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"overwriteSettings"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">UpdateSettingsPayload</span>
<span class="hljs-punctuation">}</span>
</code></pre>
                  </body>
                </html>
              </div>
            </div>
          </div>
        </section>
        <section id="definition-SettingsMutationGroupInput" class="definition definition-input-object" data-traverse-target="definition-SettingsMutationGroupInput">
          <div class="definition-group-name">
            <a href="#group-Types">Types</a>
          </div>
          <h2 class="definition-heading">SettingsMutationGroupInput</h2>
          <div class="doc-row">
            <div class="doc-copy">
              <div class="definition-description doc-copy-section">
                <h5>Description</h5>
                <p>Input for Mutation.settingsMutation, which contains fields that all settings (global, organization, and user settings) mutations need.</p>
              </div>
              <div class="definition-properties doc-copy-section">
                <h5>Fields</h5>
                <table>
                  <thead>
                    <tr>
                      <th>Input Field</th>
                      <th>Description</th>
                    </tr>
                  </thead>
                  <tbody>
                    <tr>
                      <td>
                        <span class="property-name"><code>subject</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-ID"><code>ID!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> The subject whose settings to mutate (organization, user, etc.). </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td>
                        <span class="property-name"><code>lastID</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-Int"><code>Int</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> The ID of the last-known settings known to the client, or null if there is none. This field is used to prevent race conditions when there are concurrent editors. </td>
                    </tr>
                  </tbody>
                </table>
              </div>
            </div>
            <div class="doc-examples">
              <div class="example-section example-section-is-code">
                <h5>Example</h5>
                <html>
                  <head></head>
                  <body><pre><code class="hljs language-json"><span class="hljs-punctuation">{</span><span class="hljs-attr">"subject"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-number">4</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span> <span class="hljs-attr">"lastID"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-number">987</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">}</span>
</code></pre>
                  </body>
                </html>
              </div>
            </div>
          </div>
        </section>
        <section id="definition-SettingsSubject" class="definition definition-interface" data-traverse-target="definition-SettingsSubject">
          <div class="definition-group-name">
            <a href="#group-Types">Types</a>
          </div>
          <h2 class="definition-heading">SettingsSubject</h2>
          <div class="doc-row">
            <div class="doc-copy">
              <div class="definition-description doc-copy-section">
                <h5>Description</h5>
                <p>SettingsSubject is something that can have settings: a site (&quot;global settings&quot;, which is different from &quot;site configuration&quot;), an organization, or a user.</p>
              </div>
              <div class="definition-properties definition-fields doc-copy-section">
                <h5>Fields</h5>
                <table>
                  <thead>
                    <tr>
                      <th>Field Name</th>
                      <th>Description</th>
                    </tr>
                  </thead>
                  <tbody>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>id</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-ID"><code>ID!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> The ID. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>latestSettings</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-Settings"><code>Settings</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> The latest settings. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>settingsURL</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-String"><code>String</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> The URL to the settings. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>viewerCanAdminister</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-Boolean"><code>Boolean!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> Whether the viewer can modify the subject's settings. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>settingsCascade</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-SettingsCascade"><code>SettingsCascade!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> All settings for this subject, and the individual levels in the settings cascade (global &gt; organization &gt; user) that were merged to produce the final merged settings. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name="" class="definition-deprecated"><span class="property-name"><code>configurationCascade</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-ConfigurationCascade"><code>ConfigurationCascade!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> DEPRECATED <span class="deprecation-reason">Use settingsCascade instead. This field is a deprecated alias for it and will be removed in a future release.</span>
                      </td>
                    </tr>
                  </tbody>
                </table>
              </div>
              <div class="definition-properties definition-possible-types doc-copy-section">
                <h5>Possible Types</h5>
                <table>
                  <thead>
                    <tr>
                      <th>SettingsSubject Types</th>
                    </tr>
                  </thead>
                  <tbody>
                    <tr>
                      <td>
                        <p><a href="#definition-User"><code>User</code></a></p>
                      </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td>
                        <p><a href="#definition-Org"><code>Org</code></a></p>
                      </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td>
                        <p><a href="#definition-DefaultSettings"><code>DefaultSettings</code></a></p>
                      </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td>
                        <p><a href="#definition-Site"><code>Site</code></a></p>
                      </td>
                    </tr>
                  </tbody>
                </table>
              </div>
            </div>
            <div class="doc-examples">
              <div class="example-section example-section-is-code">
                <h5>Example</h5>
                <html>
                  <head></head>
                  <body><pre><code class="hljs language-json"><span class="hljs-punctuation">{</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"id"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-number">4</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"latestSettings"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">Settings</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"settingsURL"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">"xyz789"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"viewerCanAdminister"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-literal"><span class="hljs-keyword">true</span></span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"settingsCascade"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">SettingsCascade</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"configurationCascade"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">ConfigurationCascade</span>
<span class="hljs-punctuation">}</span>
</code></pre>
                  </body>

        <section id="definition-Site" class="definition definition-object" data-traverse-target="definition-Site">
          <div class="definition-group-name">
            <a href="#group-Types">Types</a>
          </div>
          <h2 class="definition-heading">Site</h2>
          <div class="doc-row">
            <div class="doc-copy">
              <div class="definition-description doc-copy-section">
                <h5>Description</h5>
                <p>A site is an installation of Sourcegraph that consists of one or more servers that share the same configuration and database. The site is a singleton; the API only ever returns the single global site.</p>
              </div>
              <div class="definition-properties doc-copy-section">
                <h5>Fields</h5>
                <table>
                  <thead>
                    <tr>
                      <th>Field Name</th>
                      <th>Description</th>
                    </tr>
                  </thead>
                  <tbody>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>id</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-ID"><code>ID!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> The site's opaque GraphQL ID. This is NOT the "site ID" as it is referred to elsewhere; use the siteID field for that. (GraphQL node types conventionally have an id field of type ID! that globally identifies the node.) </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>siteID</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-String"><code>String!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> The site ID. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>configuration</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-SiteConfiguration"><code>SiteConfiguration!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> The site's configuration. Only visible to site admins. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>latestSettings</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-Settings"><code>Settings</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> The site's latest site-wide settings (which are the second-lowest-precedence in the configuration cascade for a user). </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>settingsCascade</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-SettingsCascade"><code>SettingsCascade!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> The global settings for this site, and the final merged settings. All viewers can access this field. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name="" class="definition-deprecated"><span class="property-name"><code>configurationCascade</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-ConfigurationCascade"><code>ConfigurationCascade!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> DEPRECATED <span class="deprecation-reason">Use settingsCascade instead. This field is a deprecated alias for it and will be removed in a future release.</span>
                      </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>settingsURL</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-String"><code>String</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> The URL to the site's settings. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>canReloadSite</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-Boolean"><code>Boolean!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> Whether the viewer can reload the site (with the reloadSite mutation). </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>viewerCanAdminister</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-Boolean"><code>Boolean!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> Whether the viewer can modify the subject's settings. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr class="row-has-field-arguments">
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>accessTokens</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-AccessTokenConnection"><code>AccessTokenConnection!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> A list of all access tokens on this site. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr class="row-field-arguments">
                      <td colspan="2">
                        <div class="field-arguments">
                          <h5 class="field-arguments-heading"> Arguments </h5>
                          <div class="field-argument-list">
                            <div class="field-argument">
                              <h6 class="field-argument-name"><span class="property-name"><code>first</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-Int"><code>Int</code></a></span>
                              </h6>
                              <p>Returns the first n access tokens from the list.</p>
                            </div>
                          </div>
                        </div>
                      </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>authProviders</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-AuthProviderConnection"><code>AuthProviderConnection!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> A list of all authentication providers. This information is visible to all viewers and does not contain any secret information. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr class="row-has-field-arguments">
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>externalAccounts</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-ExternalAccountConnection"><code>ExternalAccountConnection!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> A list of all user external accounts on this site. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr class="row-field-arguments">
                      <td colspan="2">
                        <div class="field-arguments">
                          <h5 class="field-arguments-heading"> Arguments </h5>
                          <div class="field-argument-list">
                            <div class="field-argument">
                              <h6 class="field-argument-name"><span class="property-name"><code>first</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-Int"><code>Int</code></a></span>
                              </h6>
                              <p>Returns the first n external accounts from the list.</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="field-argument">
                              <h6 class="field-argument-name"><span class="property-name"><code>user</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-ID"><code>ID</code></a></span>
                              </h6>
                              <p>Include only external accounts associated with this user.</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="field-argument">
                              <h6 class="field-argument-name"><span class="property-name"><code>serviceType</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-String"><code>String</code></a></span>
                              </h6>
                              <p>Include only external accounts with this service type.</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="field-argument">
                              <h6 class="field-argument-name"><span class="property-name"><code>serviceID</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-String"><code>String</code></a></span>
                              </h6>
                              <p>Include only external accounts with this service ID.</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="field-argument">
                              <h6 class="field-argument-name"><span class="property-name"><code>clientID</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-String"><code>String</code></a></span>
                              </h6>
                              <p>Include only external accounts with this client ID.</p>
                            </div>
                          </div>
                        </div>
                      </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>buildVersion</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-String"><code>String!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> The build version of the Sourcegraph software that is running on this site (of the form NNNNN_YYYY-MM-DD_XXXXX, like 12345_2018-01-01_abcdef). </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>productVersion</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-String"><code>String!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> The product version of the Sourcegraph software that is running on this site. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>updateCheck</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-UpdateCheck"><code>UpdateCheck!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> Information about software updates for the version of Sourcegraph that this site is running. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>needsRepositoryConfiguration</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-Boolean"><code>Boolean!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> Whether the site needs to be configured to add repositories. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>externalServicesFromFile</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-Boolean"><code>Boolean!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> Whether the external services haven been created from a configuration file specified in the EXTSVC_CONFIG_FILE. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>allowEditExternalServicesWithFile</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-Boolean"><code>Boolean!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> Whether the external services can be updated even if <code>externalServicesFromFile</code> is true. All changes made while <code>externalServicesFromFile</code> is true will be discarded once Sourcegraph restarts. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>freeUsersExceeded</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-Boolean"><code>Boolean!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> Whether the site is over the limit for free user accounts, and a warning needs to be shown to all users. Only applies if the site does not have a valid license. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>alerts</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-Alert"><code>[Alert!]!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> Alerts to display to the viewer. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>hasCodeIntelligence</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-Boolean"><code>Boolean!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> BACKCOMPAT: Always returns true. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>sendsEmailVerificationEmails</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-Boolean"><code>Boolean!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> Whether the server sends emails to users to verify email addresses. If false, then site admins must manually verify users' email addresses. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>productSubscription</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-ProductSubscriptionStatus"><code>ProductSubscriptionStatus!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> Information about this site's product subscription status. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr class="row-has-field-arguments">
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>usageStatistics</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-SiteUsageStatistics"><code>SiteUsageStatistics!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> Usage statistics for this site. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr class="row-field-arguments">
                      <td colspan="2">
                        <div class="field-arguments">
                          <h5 class="field-arguments-heading"> Arguments </h5>
                          <div class="field-argument-list">
                            <div class="field-argument">
                              <h6 class="field-argument-name"><span class="property-name"><code>days</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-Int"><code>Int</code></a></span>
                              </h6>
                              <p>Days of history (based on current UTC time).</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="field-argument">
                              <h6 class="field-argument-name"><span class="property-name"><code>weeks</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-Int"><code>Int</code></a></span>
                              </h6>
                              <p>Weeks of history (based on current UTC time).</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="field-argument">
                              <h6 class="field-argument-name"><span class="property-name"><code>months</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-Int"><code>Int</code></a></span>
                              </h6>
                              <p>Months of history (based on current UTC time).</p>
                            </div>
                          </div>
                        </div>
                      </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>analytics</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-Analytics"><code>Analytics!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> New usage statistics/analytics for this site. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr class="row-has-field-arguments">
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>users</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-SiteUsers"><code>SiteUsers!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> List all users. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr class="row-field-arguments">
                      <td colspan="2">
                        <div class="field-arguments">
                          <h5 class="field-arguments-heading"> Arguments </h5>
                          <div class="field-argument-list">
                            <div class="field-argument">
                              <h6 class="field-argument-name"><span class="property-name"><code>query</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-String"><code>String</code></a></span>
                              </h6>
                              <p>Return users whose usernames or display names match the query.</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="field-argument">
                              <h6 class="field-argument-name"><span class="property-name"><code>siteAdmin</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-Boolean"><code>Boolean</code></a></span>
                              </h6>
                              <p>Returns users who have been active in a given period of time.</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="field-argument">
                              <h6 class="field-argument-name"><span class="property-name"><code>username</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-String"><code>String</code></a></span>
                              </h6>
                              <p>Returns users that contain filter in the username field.</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="field-argument">
                              <h6 class="field-argument-name"><span class="property-name"><code>email</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-String"><code>String</code></a></span>
                              </h6>
                              <p>Returns users that contain filter in the email field.</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="field-argument">
                              <h6 class="field-argument-name"><span class="property-name"><code>lastActiveAt</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-SiteUsersDateRangeInput"><code>SiteUsersDateRangeInput</code></a></span>
                              </h6>
                              <p>Returns users for the given lastActive enum period. When omitted does NOT apply and returns for all period available.</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="field-argument">
                              <h6 class="field-argument-name"><span class="property-name"><code>deletedAt</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-SiteUsersDateRangeInput"><code>SiteUsersDateRangeInput</code></a></span>
                              </h6>
                              <p>Returns either deleted or not deleted users. Returns all users when omitted.</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="field-argument">
                              <h6 class="field-argument-name"><span class="property-name"><code>createdAt</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-SiteUsersDateRangeInput"><code>SiteUsersDateRangeInput</code></a></span>
                              </h6>
                              <p>Returns users who where created within a given date time range.</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="field-argument">
                              <h6 class="field-argument-name"><span class="property-name"><code>eventsCount</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-SiteUsersNumberRangeInput"><code>SiteUsersNumberRangeInput</code></a></span>
                              </h6>
                              <p>Returns users whose events count within a given range.</p>
                            </div>
                          </div>
                        </div>
                      </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>monitoringStatistics</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-MonitoringStatistics"><code>MonitoringStatistics!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> Monitoring overview for this site. Note: This is primarily used for displaying recently-fired alerts in the web app. If your intent is to monitor Sourcegraph, it is better to configure alerting or query Prometheus directly in order to ensure that if the frontend goes down you still receive alerts: Configure alerting: <a href="https://docs.sourcegraph.com/admin/observability/alerting">https://docs.sourcegraph.com/admin/observability/alerting</a> Query Prometheus directly: <a href="https://docs.sourcegraph.com/admin/observability/alerting_custom_consumption">https://docs.sourcegraph.com/admin/observability/alerting_custom_consumption</a> </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>allowSiteSettingsEdits</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-Boolean"><code>Boolean!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> Whether changes can be made to site settings through the API. When global settings are configured through the GLOBAL_SETTINGS_FILE environment variable, site settings edits cannot be made through the API. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>enableLegacyExtensions</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-Boolean"><code>Boolean!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> Whether to enable the extension registry and the use of extensions. Reflects the site configuration <code>enableLegacyExtensions</code> experimental feature value. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>upgradeReadiness</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-UpgradeReadiness"><code>UpgradeReadiness!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> FOR INTERNAL USE ONLY: Returns information about instance upgrade readiness. </td>
                    </tr>
                  </tbody>
                </table>
              </div>
            </div>
            <div class="doc-examples">
              <div class="example-section example-section-is-code">
                <h5>Example</h5>
                <html>
                  <head></head>
                  <body><pre><code class="hljs language-json"><span class="hljs-punctuation">{</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"id"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-number">4</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"siteID"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">"abc123"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"configuration"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">SiteConfiguration</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"latestSettings"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">Settings</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"settingsCascade"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">SettingsCascade</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"configurationCascade"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">ConfigurationCascade</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"settingsURL"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">"abc123"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"canReloadSite"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-literal"><span class="hljs-keyword">true</span></span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>

  <span class="hljs-attr">"accessTokens"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">AccessTokenConnection</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"authProviders"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">AuthProviderConnection</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"externalAccounts"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">ExternalAccountConnection</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"buildVersion"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">"xyz789"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"productVersion"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">"xyz789"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"updateCheck"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">UpdateCheck</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"needsRepositoryConfiguration"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-literal"><span class="hljs-keyword">true</span></span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"externalServicesFromFile"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-literal"><span class="hljs-keyword">true</span></span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"allowEditExternalServicesWithFile"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-literal"><span class="hljs-keyword">true</span></span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"freeUsersExceeded"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-literal"><span class="hljs-keyword">true</span></span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>

  <span class="hljs-attr">"hasCodeIntelligence"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-literal"><span class="hljs-keyword">true</span></span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"sendsEmailVerificationEmails"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-literal"><span class="hljs-keyword">true</span></span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"productSubscription"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">ProductSubscriptionStatus</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"usageStatistics"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">SiteUsageStatistics</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"analytics"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">Analytics</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>

  <span class="hljs-attr">"enableLegacyExtensions"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-literal"><span class="hljs-keyword">false</span></span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>

<span class="hljs-punctuation">}</span>
</code></pre>
                  </body>
                </html>
              </div>

        </section>
        <section id="definition-SiteConfiguration" class="definition definition-object" data-traverse-target="definition-SiteConfiguration">
          <div class="definition-group-name">
            <a href="#group-Types">Types</a>
          </div>
          <h2 class="definition-heading">SiteConfiguration</h2>
          <div class="doc-row">
            <div class="doc-copy">
              <div class="definition-description doc-copy-section">
                <h5>Description</h5>
                <p>The configuration for a site.</p>
              </div>
              <div class="definition-properties doc-copy-section">
                <h5>Fields</h5>
                <table>
                  <thead>
                    <tr>
                      <th>Field Name</th>
                      <th>Description</th>
                    </tr>
                  </thead>
                  <tbody>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>id</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-Int"><code>Int!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> The unique identifier of this site configuration version. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>effectiveContents</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-JSONCString"><code>JSONCString!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> The effective configuration JSON. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>validationMessages</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-String"><code>[String!]!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> Messages describing validation problems or usage of deprecated configuration in the configuration JSON. This includes both JSON Schema validation problems and other messages that perform more advanced checks on the configuration (that can't be expressed in the JSON Schema). </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr class="row-has-field-arguments">
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>history</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-SiteConfigurationChangeConnection"><code>SiteConfigurationChangeConnection</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> EXPERIMENTAL: A list of diffs to depict what changed since the previous version of this configuration. Only site admins may perform this query. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr class="row-field-arguments">
                      <td colspan="2">
                        <div class="field-arguments">
                          <h5 class="field-arguments-heading"> Arguments </h5>
                          <div class="field-argument-list">
                            <div class="field-argument">
                              <h6 class="field-argument-name"><span class="property-name"><code>first</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-Int"><code>Int</code></a></span>
                              </h6>
                              <p>The number of nodes to return starting from the beginning (oldest). Note: Use either first or last (see below) in the query. Setting both will return an error.</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="field-argument">
                              <h6 class="field-argument-name"><span class="property-name"><code>last</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-Int"><code>Int</code></a></span>
                              </h6>
                              <p>The number of nodes to return starting from the end (latest). Note: Use either last or first (see above) in the query. Setting both will return an error.</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="field-argument">
                              <h6 class="field-argument-name"><span class="property-name"><code>after</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-String"><code>String</code></a></span>
                              </h6>
                              <p>Opaque pagination cursor to be used when paginating forwards that may be also used in conjunction with &quot;first&quot; to return the first N nodes.</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="field-argument">
                              <h6 class="field-argument-name"><span class="property-name"><code>before</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-String"><code>String</code></a></span>
                              </h6>
                              <p>Opaque pagination cursor to be used when paginating backwards that may be also used in conjunction with &quot;last&quot; to return the last N nodes.</p>
                            </div>
                          </div>
                        </div>
                      </td>
                    </tr>
                  </tbody>
                </table>
              </div>
            </div>
            <div class="doc-examples">
              <div class="example-section example-section-is-code">
                <h5>Example</h5>
                <html>
                  <head></head>
                  <body><pre><code class="hljs language-json"><span class="hljs-punctuation">{</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"id"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-number">123</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"effectiveContents"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">JSONCString</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"validationMessages"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-punctuation">[</span><span class="hljs-string">"abc123"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">]</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"history"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">SiteConfigurationChangeConnection</span>
<span class="hljs-punctuation">}</span>
</code></pre>
                  </body>
                </html>
              </div>
            </div>
          </div>
        </section>
        <section id="definition-SiteConfigurationChange" class="definition definition-object" data-traverse-target="definition-SiteConfigurationChange">
          <div class="definition-group-name">
            <a href="#group-Types">Types</a>
          </div>
          <h2 class="definition-heading">SiteConfigurationChange</h2>
          <div class="doc-row">
            <div class="doc-copy">
              <div class="definition-description doc-copy-section">
                <h5>Description</h5>
                <p>A diff representing the change in the site config compared to the previous version.</p>
              </div>
              <div class="definition-properties doc-copy-section">
                <h5>Fields</h5>
                <table>
                  <thead>
                    <tr>
                      <th>Field Name</th>
                      <th>Description</th>
                    </tr>
                  </thead>
                  <tbody>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>id</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-ID"><code>ID!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> The ID of the site config in the history. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>author</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-User"><code>User</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> The user who made this change. If empty, it indicates that either the author's information is not available or the change in the site config was applied via an internal process (example: site startup or SITE_CONFIG_FILE being reloaded). </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>reproducedDiff</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-Boolean"><code>Boolean!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> A flag to indicate if the diff of changes to the previous site configuration was reproduced or not. Sometimes it may not be possible to generate a diff (for example the redacted contents are not available) in which case the value of the flag will be false. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>diff</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-String"><code>String</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> The diff string when diffed against the previous site config. When this is null there was no diff to the previous change. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>createdAt</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-DateTime"><code>DateTime!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> The timestamp when this change in the site config was applied. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>updatedAt</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-DateTime"><code>DateTime!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> The timestamp when this change in the site config was modified. Usually this should be the same as createdAt as entries in the site config history are considered immutable. </td>
                    </tr>
                  </tbody>
                </table>
              </div>
            </div>
            <div class="doc-examples">
              <div class="example-section example-section-is-code">

  <span class="hljs-attr">"id"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">"4"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"author"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">User</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"reproducedDiff"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-literal"><span class="hljs-keyword">true</span></span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"diff"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">"abc123"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"createdAt"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">"2007-12-03T10:15:30Z"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"updatedAt"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">"2007-12-03T10:15:30Z"</span>

        <section id="definition-SurveyResponseConnection" class="definition definition-object" data-traverse-target="definition-SurveyResponseConnection">

          <div class="doc-row">

              <div class="definition-description doc-copy-section">
                <h5>Description</h5>
                <p>A list of survey responses</p>
              </div>
              <div class="definition-properties doc-copy-section">
                <h5>Fields</h5>
                <table>
                  <thead>
                    <tr>
                      <th>Field Name</th>
                      <th>Description</th>
                    </tr>
                  </thead>
                  <tbody>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>nodes</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-SurveyResponse"><code>[SurveyResponse!]!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> A list of survey responses. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>totalCount</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-Int"><code>Int!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> The total count of survey responses in the connection. This total count may be larger than the number of nodes in this object when the result is paginated. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>last30DaysCount</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-Int"><code>Int!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> The count of survey responses submitted since 30 calendar days ago at 00:00 UTC. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>averageScore</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-Float"><code>Float!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> The average score of survey responses in the connection submitted since 30 calendar days ago at 00:00 UTC. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>netPromoterScore</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-Int"><code>Int!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> The net promoter score (NPS) of survey responses in the connection submitted since 30 calendar days ago at 00:00 UTC. Return value is a signed integer, scaled from -100 (all detractors) to +100 (all promoters). See <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Net_Promoter">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Net_Promoter</a> for explanation. </td>
                    </tr>

<span class="hljs-punctuation">}</span>
</code></pre>

        <section id="definition-Symbol" class="definition definition-object" data-traverse-target="definition-Symbol">
          <div class="definition-group-name">
            <a href="#group-Types">Types</a>
          </div>
          <h2 class="definition-heading">Symbol</h2>
          <div class="doc-row">
            <div class="doc-copy">
              <div class="definition-description doc-copy-section">
                <h5>Description</h5>
                <p>A code symbol (e.g., a function, variable, type, class, etc.). It is derived from DocumentSymbol as defined in the Language Server Protocol (see <a href="https://microsoft.github.io/language-server-protocol/specifications/specification-3-14/#textDocument_documentSymbol">https://microsoft.github.io/language-server-protocol/specifications/specification-3-14/#textDocument_documentSymbol</a>).</p>
              </div>
              <div class="definition-properties doc-copy-section">
                <h5>Fields</h5>
                <table>
                  <thead>
                    <tr>
                      <th>Field Name</th>
                      <th>Description</th>
                    </tr>
                  </thead>
                  <tbody>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>name</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-String"><code>String!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> The name of the symbol. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>containerName</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-String"><code>String</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> The name of the symbol that contains this symbol, if any. This field's value is not guaranteed to be structured in such a way that callers can infer a hierarchy of symbols. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>kind</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-SymbolKind"><code>SymbolKind!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> The kind of the symbol. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>language</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-String"><code>String!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> The programming language of the symbol. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>location</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-Location"><code>Location!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> The location where this symbol is defined. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>url</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-String"><code>String!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> The URL to this symbol (using the input revision specifier, which may not be immutable). </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>canonicalURL</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-String"><code>String!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> The canonical URL to this symbol (using an immutable revision specifier). </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>fileLocal</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-Boolean"><code>Boolean!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> Whether or not the symbol is local to the file it's defined in. </td>
                    </tr>
                  </tbody>
                </table>
              </div>
            </div>
            <div class="doc-examples">
              <div class="example-section example-section-is-code">
                <h5>Example</h5>
                <html>
                  <head></head>
                  <body><pre><code class="hljs language-json"><span class="hljs-punctuation">{</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"name"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">"abc123"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"containerName"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">"abc123"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"kind"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">"UNKNOWN"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"language"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">"abc123"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"location"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">Location</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"url"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">"abc123"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"canonicalURL"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-string">"abc123"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">,</span>
  <span class="hljs-attr">"fileLocal"</span><span class="hljs-punctuation">:</span> <span class="hljs-literal"><span class="hljs-keyword">false</span></span>
<span class="hljs-punctuation">}</span>
</code></pre>
                  </body>
                </html>
              </div>
            </div>
          </div>
        </section>

        <section id="definition-Team" class="definition definition-object" data-traverse-target="definition-Team">
          <div class="definition-group-name">
            <a href="#group-Types">Types</a>
          </div>
          <h2 class="definition-heading">Team</h2>
          <div class="doc-row">
            <div class="doc-copy">
              <div class="definition-description doc-copy-section">
                <h5>Description</h5>
                <p>A team is a grouping of users/persons into a common handle. Teams are commonly used to define codeowners.</p>
              </div>
              <div class="definition-properties doc-copy-section">
                <h5>Fields</h5>
                <table>
                  <thead>
                    <tr>
                      <th>Field Name</th>
                      <th>Description</th>
                    </tr>
                  </thead>
                  <tbody>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>id</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-ID"><code>ID!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> The unique ID of the team. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>name</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-String"><code>String!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> The name of the team. Needs to be globally unique across usernames, organization names, and team names. Team names can use alphanumeric characters, - dash and / forward slash. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>url</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-String"><code>String!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> URL to link to the teams profile page. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>displayName</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-String"><code>String</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> A human readable name substitute for the name. Null, if not defined. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr>
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>readonly</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-Boolean"><code>Boolean!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> A team can be made read-only from the CLI instructing the UI to show a warning banner that this is managed externally, and management features will only be available to site-admins. It can also still be manipulated from the CLI. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr class="row-has-field-arguments">
                      <td data-property-name=""><span class="property-name"><code>members</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-TeamMemberConnection"><code>TeamMemberConnection!</code></a></span>
                      </td>
                      <td> The teams direct members. That is members that are strictly part of this team, but not members of child teams. Team membership is NOT inherited. </td>
                    </tr>
                    <tr class="row-field-arguments">
                      <td colspan="2">
                        <div class="field-arguments">
                          <h5 class="field-arguments-heading"> Arguments </h5>
                          <div class="field-argument-list">
                            <div class="field-argument">
                              <h6 class="field-argument-name"><span class="property-name"><code>first</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-Int"><code>Int</code></a></span>
                              </h6>
                              <p>Returns the first n team members from the list.</p>
                            </div>
                            <div class="field-argument">
                              <h6 class="field-argument-name"><span class="property-name"><code>after</code></span> - <span class="property-type"><a href="#definition-String"><code>String</code></a></span>
                              </h6>

        <section id="definition-TreeEntry" class="definition definition-interface" data-traverse-target="definition-TreeEntry">
